bioghist.p: Jane (1776-1850) and Anna Maria Porter (1780-1832), who both lived in London and Surrey later on, were sisters of Sir Robert Ker Porter (1777-1842), the historical painter.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes manuscripts donated by John C. Mendenhall, including Beville Park or, The triumph of friendship. mss [Porter]; other (untitled) manuscript fragments by Jane Porter (supposed author); letters from Jane Porter; manuscript letters of Sir Robert Ker Porter, Elizabeth Montague, Charlotte Smith, Edward Francisco Burney, and Sydney Morgan; and unsigned poems and a typescript entitled "Ferney: An Epistle to Monsr de Voltaire."

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
